name: Guillermo Colmenero
body:
### Hello!
I am a software developer from Montevideo, Uruguay. I enjoy building everything from web apps for startups to industrial critical systems. If I'm not working remotely on projects for clients all over the world, I'm learning new technologies or doing research at [Universidad ORT](http://fi.ort.edu.uy/compute/english-version).

### Specialties


 * Project Management
  * Traditional (From the PMBOK)
  * Process management (CMMI, SPICE, ISO 9002)
  * Agile (Scrum, PP, XP)
 *  Back-end Development
  * Python (Django, Celery, Scipy, Virtualenv, Scrapy, Twisted)
  * Java (JEE, Spring, Android SDK, Maven, Gradle)
  * JavaScript (NodeJS, Express Framework) 
  * SQL (MySQL, PostgreSQL)
  * NoSQL (Redis, Cassandra, MongoDB, Memcached)
  * C# (MVC, WCF, EF)
  * SCM (Git, Subversion)
  * C99

 * DevOps
  * Debian GNU/Linux (Bash Scripting, APT, Pipes, Cron, iptables, etc)
  * I been studying and using the full network stack
  * CI (Jenkins)
  * Web Servers (Apache2, nginx, Jetty)

 * Front-end Development
  * JavaScript (jQuery, AngularJS, Underscore)
  * HTML5
  * CSS3
  * Usability
 

### Research
In computer science, formal methods are a particular kind of mathematically based techniques for the specification, development and verification of software and hardware systems. The use of formal methods for software is motivated by the expectation that, as in other engineering disciplines, performing appropriate mathematical analysis can contribute to the reliability and robustness of a design.
I'm using formal methods verify industry critical algorithms [(Link)](https://github.com/narrowfail/formal).


### My services

I'm offering my services through [pyspring](http://www.pyspring.com). We give our fresh technological vision and expertise to companies and help them innovate their established businesses or just start from scratch.

### Contact

Skype: guillermocolmenero  
Email: same as skype @ gmail  
Phone: +598 98 898 786  
Timezone: [GMT: -03:00 (UYT)](http://www.timeanddate.com/time/zone/uruguay/montevideo)

You can reach me via email to schedule a call. You can use [this tool](http://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/meeting.html) to do the time zone math.

### Some Links

LinkedIn - [linkedin.com/in/guillermocolmenero](linkedin.com/in/guillermocolmenero)  
AngelList - [angel.co/guillermo-colmenero](angel.co/guillermo-colmenero)  
Github - [github.com/narrowfail](github.com/narrowfail)
